definition[0]: a business or activity that produces large profits
example[0]: The nightclub turned out to be a goldmine.
definition[1]: a place where gold is dug out from a hole in the ground
example[1]: Pay-per-view television, under the right circumstances, is a proven gold mine.
definition[2]: to own something very valuable, especially without realizing it
example[2]: The three companies realized they were sitting on a gold mine: a computerized directory containing the names and addresses of most people in America
definition[3]: a deep hole or system of holes under ground from which rock containing gold is taken
example[3]: The Hayden Hill gold mine is expected to produce about 145,000 ounces of gold a year.
